input: Optimize wind-turbine farm operations by analyzing live data, adjusting parameters within safety constraints, monitoring results, and reporting performance improvements.

steps:
Uses: Live Turbine Sensor Data, Turbine Specifications
Action: Connect to SCADA system and manufacturer API to aggregate operational metrics
Produces: Raw sensor data stream + technical parameter reference table
Stores/Sends To: Data lake (e.g., Amazon S3, Azure Data Lake)

Uses: Safety Constraints, Live Turbine Sensor Data
Action: Compare real-time metrics against user-defined thresholds
Produces: Compliance status matrix (boolean flags for each constraint)
Stores/Sends To: Validation service (in-memory state)

Uses: Live Turbine Sensor Data, Historical Performance Data
Action: Calculate current efficiency ratio vs historical benchmarks
Produces: Efficiency gap report (percentage deviation from optimal)
Stores/Sends To: Analytics database (e.g., PostgreSQL)

Uses: Optimization Algorithm, Efficiency gap report, Safety Constraints
Action: Run ML model to generate constrained parameter adjustments
Produces: Proposed parameter set (pitch angle Δ, yaw position Δ)
Stores/Sends To: Actuation queue (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka)

Uses: Proposed parameter set, Compliance status matrix
Action: Push validated adjustments to turbine controllers via OPC UA protocol
Produces: Execution confirmation log
Stores/Sends To: SCADA system audit trail

Uses: Live Turbine Sensor Data (post-adjustment), Efficiency gap report
Action: Track key metrics before/after optimization in time-series database
Produces: Delta analysis dashboard (energy output vs. pre-optimization)
Stores/Sends To: Grafana/Power BI instance

Uses: Delta analysis dashboard, Efficiency gap report
Action: Generate PDF report with statistical significance calculations
Produces: Final performance improvement documentation
Stores/Sends To: Document management system (e.g., SharePoint, Google Drive)

[DEPTH STOP CONDITIONS MET: All DERIVABLE inputs (e.g., efficiency gap report) have been decomposed into SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE/USER-CONTROLLED leaf inputs]
execution_plan.raw_response:
Inputs:
1. Live Turbine Sensor Data
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: SCADA system/IoT platform (e.g., OSIsoft PI, AWS IoT Core)
   Input Data: Real-time metrics (wind speed, rotor RPM, power output, temperature)
   Bound Reference: None

2. Safety Constraints
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Turbine operator/engineering team
   Input Data: Numeric thresholds (max RPM, temperature limits, vibration tolerances)
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

3. Turbine Specifications
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Manufacturer database (e.g., Siemens Gamesa, Vestas API)
   Input Data: Technical parameters (rated capacity, cut-in wind speed, blade length)
   Bound Reference: None

4. Historical Performance Data
   Source Type: SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE
   Source Origin: Data warehouse (e.g., Snowflake, Google BigQuery)
   Input Data: Past operational metrics (monthly energy production, downtime records)
   Bound Reference: None

5. Optimization Algorithm
   Source Type: USER-CONTROLLED
   Source Origin: Data science team
   Input Data: Machine learning model (parameter adjustment logic)
   Note: Requires explicit user provision or linkage.

Outputs:
1. Adjusted Turbine Parameters
   Type: System update
   Description: New setpoints for pitch angle, yaw position, and generator torque
   Verification: API response from turbine controllers

2. Performance Improvement Report
   Type: PDF/HTML document
   Description: Comparative analysis (energy output increase, downtime reduction)
   Verification: File checksum and timestamp

3. Monitoring Dashboard Update
   Type: System state change
   Description: Real-time visualization of optimized metrics
   Verification: Dashboard API endpoint response

Steps:
Step 1: Data Collection
Uses: Live Turbine Sensor Data, Turbine Specifications
Action: Connect to SCADA system and manufacturer API to aggregate operational metrics
Produces: Raw sensor data stream + technical parameter reference table
Stores/Sends To: Data lake (e.g., Amazon S3, Azure Data Lake)

Step 2: Constraint Validation
Uses: Safety Constraints, Live Turbine Sensor Data
Action: Compare real-time metrics against user-defined thresholds
Produces: Compliance status matrix (boolean flags for each constraint)
Stores/Sends To: Validation service (in-memory state)

Step 3: Efficiency Analysis
Uses: Live Turbine Sensor Data, Historical Performance Data
Action: Calculate current efficiency ratio vs historical benchmarks
Produces: Efficiency gap report (percentage deviation from optimal)
Stores/Sends To: Analytics database (e.g., PostgreSQL)

Step 4: Parameter Optimization
Uses: Optimization Algorithm, Efficiency gap report, Safety Constraints
Action: Run ML model to generate constrained parameter adjustments
Produces: Proposed parameter set (pitch angle Δ, yaw position Δ)
Stores/Sends To: Actuation queue (e.g., RabbitMQ, Kafka)

Step 5: Turbine Adjustment
Uses: Proposed parameter set, Compliance status matrix
Action: Push validated adjustments to turbine controllers via OPC UA protocol
Produces: Execution confirmation log
Stores/Sends To: SCADA system audit trail

Step 6: Performance Monitoring
Uses: Live Turbine Sensor Data (post-adjustment), Efficiency gap report
Action: Track key metrics before/after optimization in time-series database
Produces: Delta analysis dashboard (energy output vs. pre-optimization)
Stores/Sends To: Grafana/Power BI instance

Step 7: Reporting
Uses: Delta analysis dashboard, Efficiency gap report
Action: Generate PDF report with statistical significance calculations
Produces: Final performance improvement documentation
Stores/Sends To: Document management system (e.g., SharePoint, Google Drive)

[DEPTH STOP CONDITIONS MET: All DERIVABLE inputs (e.g., efficiency gap report) have been decomposed into SYSTEM-RETRIEVABLE/USER-CONTROLLED leaf inputs]
